units.title: List of Experiments
units.topics: Write a program to sort an array (make a dynamic array) using Bubble sort. Use 1-bit variable FLAG to signal when no interchange take place during pass. If FLAG is 0 after any pass, then list is already sorted and there is no need to continue._Write a program to search an ITEM (integer) in an array using binary search, if FOUND then delete that item from array and if NOT FOUND than insert that item in kth position (Input “k” from user)._Write a program to enter records of Five students, which should contain fields like roll No., name, CGPI, semester. (a) List all record of all students having CGPI greater than k. (b) Insert a new record of student at kth position and print the final record._Implement linked list and insert and delete an element into the list._Evaluate a postfix algebraic expression with the help of stack._Implement a queue using arrays and linked list._Implement a binary tree and implement any traversal technique as you like._Implement a binary Search Tree and insert and delete a node in the BST._Implement Max Priority queue using Max Heap. _Implement a graph and find transpose of a graph where Transpose of a directed graph G is another directed graph on the same set of vertices with all of the edges reversed compared to the orientation of the corresponding edges in G. That is, if G contains an edge (u, v) then the converse/transpose/reverse of G contains an edge (v, u) and vice versa. Implement it with the help of adjacency list and adjacency matrix. _Implement Quick Sort, Merge Sort, Insertion Sort and Selection Sort

units.title: List of Experiments
units.topics: Using virtual lab,  implement  i)  Ripple Carry Adder, ii)     Carry-Look-Ahead Adder, iii)     Wallace Tree Adder.._Using virtual lab, implement  i)  Synthesis of Flip Flops, ii)   Registers and Counters. _Using virtual lab implement i) Combinational Multipliers, ii)    Booth's Multiplier._Using  logisim  simulator design  i) 8 bit   Arithmetic Logic Unit, ii) 16 bit Arithmetic Unit._Simulate  Datapath for processor  using procsim simulator. _Design control path using Finite State Machine for CPU._Write a program to understand register and memory allocation in registers for MIPS architecture._Design Memory (Design of a RAM Cell and 4*4 RAM)._Write a program to find the factorial of a number in MIPS, C, FORTRAN and Python. Check the maximum data size for which factorial could be calculated. Find out how the overflow conditions are handled by different processors._Write a program to implement Karnaugh Map _Implement the cache memory  approaches  i) Associative cache Design, ii) Direct Mapped cache Design using ParaCache simulator

units.title: List of Experiments
units.topics: Practice various commands/utilities in MS Windows and Linux OS for the following: • File management: create, copy, delete, link, display content, printing •Directory handling: create, delete, relocate, display content, sharing •Security features: setting/resetting file permissions to read, write, execute • Network configuration_Learn the top command to display resource utilization statistics of processes. _Simulate various CPU scheduling algorithms (FCFS, SJF-preemptive & no preemptive, Priority Scheduling-preemptive & no preemptive and Round Robin). Run your simulator for each scheduling policy, with a variety of quantum values. For each version of the simulator, for each input data file, for each quantum value, plot the completion time, throughput, average job elapsed time and average job waiting time. Analyze the behavior of your scheduler._Write a program to simulate Banker’s algorithm for deadlock handling._Simulate memory allocation algorithms (First Fit and Best Fit)._Simulate different page replacement strategies (FIFO, LRU and Optimal) and compare their performance._Using the fork(…) system call, write a program in which the parent creates a child and the child creates a grandchild. Synchronize the processes so that the grandchild first displays a message (and then terminates), the child displays a message (and then terminates), and finally the parent displays a message. _Simulate (at least three) disk scheduling protocols._Write a program to display the IP address and MAC address of a machine._Write script to implement background process that will continually print current time in upper right corner of the screen, while user can do his/her normal job at prompt._Write shell script to show various system configuration like • Currently logged user and his logname • Your current shell •Your home directory •Your current path setting •Your current working directory • Show Currently logged number of users • About your OS and version, release number, kernel version •Show all available shells • Show computer CPU information like processor type, speed, etc. •Show memory information •Show hard disk information like size of hard-disk, cache memory, model, etc. • File system (Mounted)_Installation and configuration of MS Windows and Linux OS

units.title: List of Experiments
units.topics: To verify the Betti’s Law& Maxwell law of reciprocal displacements._Study of a three hinged arch experimentally for a given set of loading and compare with analytical results._To obtain experimental influence line diagram for horizontal thrust in a three hinged arch and compare with theoretical value._To determine the flexural rigidity of a given beam._To study the behavior of different type of struts._To verify moment area theorem for slopes and deflections of a beam_To find the deflection of a pin-connected truss and to verify the results by calculation and graphically._To determine the carry over factors for beam with rigid connections._To determine the rotational stiffness of a beam when far end is (a) fixed (b) pinned._Determine experimentally the horizontal displacement of the roller end of a two hinged arch for a given set of loading and to compare the results with those obtained analytically._To obtain experimental influence line diagram for horizontal thrust in a two hinged arch and compare with theoretical value._To study tensile stress and strain on different materials
